Description: Late Roman pottery pilgrim flask; thin lentoid body with a narrow, concave neck and plan mouth; pair of opposing vertical handles arching form shoulder to rim; coarse orange clay, crudely incised with concentric grooves on one side.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
